quest.name: Old Heroes Never Die
journal: The secretariat appears to have been waiting for you.

The secretariat brings grave tidings: a Lominsan merchantman carrying a haul of O'Ghomoro crystals was taken by a Sahagin raiding party. In light of this, Merlwyb suspects that the Crushing Tide have a mind to summon the Lord of the Whorl once more. In hopes of forestalling such a calamitous turn of events, she means to meet with her Sahagin ally Noll and his compatriots at South Tidegate, and bids you join her there.

To your dismay, Noll confirms that Doww and the Crushing Tide do indeed seek to summon Leviathan in hopes of bolstering their ranks. With Limsa's forces already stretched thin defending the coast from the beasts born of the Final Days, you suggest that the Company of Heroes might be summoned back to help combat the threat. Unfortunately, Merlwyb explains that they disbanded before the Calamity, and their leader has not been seen since. All hope is not lost, however, as Merlwyb has a plan, and asks that you meet her at the Drowning Wench for a discussion with the Company's erstwhile first mate, Wheiskaet.

Joined by the other former members of the Company of Heroes, Wheiskaet listens patiently as Merlwyb makes her pitch. At first, he is reluctant to agree to the Admiral's proposal, but acquiesces when she states that you could lead them in their absent commander's stead. An arrangement is reached, and thus do you resolve to learn more of the storied veterans, that you might more effectively utilize their talents.

A brief conversation with Wheiskaet and the individual members of the Company allows you to take stock of their abilities and assign each to the task which you deem them best suited. Your general plan of attack decided upon, the Company takes their leave, and you and Merlwyb decide to return to Maelstrom Command to make preparations for the coming mission.

Back at Maelstrom Command, the secretariat furnishes you with a linkpearl, formally establishing a new linkshell with you and the Company of Heroes. Duly equipped, you resolve to stay at the ready until the time is right for you and those you command to enter the fray.

※The next role quest will be available from the Maelstrom secretariat upon reaching level 88 in any melee DPS class.
objectives: Speak with Merlwyb at South Tidegate.

dialogue.name: LIMSASECRETARY
dialogue.text: The Admiral left a message for you─and the news is not good.

dialogue.name: LIMSASECRETARY
dialogue.text: It appears that a Lominsan merchant ship was assailed by a Sahagin raiding party affiliated with the Crushing Tide.

dialogue.name: LIMSASECRETARY
dialogue.text: To further complicate matters, the vessel in question was carrying a shipment of crystals supplied to us by the kobolds of O'Ghomoro.

dialogue.name: LIMSASECRETARY
dialogue.text: The Admiral suspects that Doww means to use the plundered crystals to summon Leviathan. She has gone to meet with Noll, that we and our Sahagin allies might take swift action.

dialogue.name: LIMSASECRETARY
dialogue.text: She bids you join her immediately. Should the worst come to the worst, your experience in combating primals may prove essential.

dialogue.name: LIMSASECRETARY
dialogue.text: Pray make for South Tidegate and rendezvous with Admiral Bloefhiswyn at once.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming, Forename.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: The situation is grim. The Crushing Tide plundered one of our trading ships and seized a goodly stash of O'Ghomoro crystals.

dialogue.name: NOLL
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Though their aim is clear, it appears they yet lack the quantity needed to perform the sssummoning.

dialogue.name: NOLL
dialogue.text: Doww longs for the days when every Sahagin cried out for Lord Leviathan's deliverance, and will ssstop at nothing to see them return.

dialogue.name: NOLL
dialogue.text: I cannot fathom what the Crushing Tide are thinking. What sssatisfaction, what happiness can be found in giving over their hearts and minds to a false god?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: And so we must thwart their designs, lest the bonds we have forged be forever broken.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: By the same token, we cannot ignore the blasphemy, nor the transformations its presence may bring about.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: A battle on two fronts─neither of which we can commit to at the expense of the other...

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: As we sail into the eye of the storm, I would hear your counsel. What course of action would you propose?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Might we turn to the three great pirate powers for aid?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Let us recruit the Yellowjackets to the cause.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Sounds like a job for the Company of Heroes...

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: As it happens, I've already enlisted the Executioners, the Krakens, and the Sirens to the cause. They've done much to bolster the Maelstrom's efforts to scour the seas for the blasphemy.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: So if we're to seek reinforcements, we will have to turn elsewhere. But to whom?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: The Yellowjackets are spread thin keeping the coast safe from the Crushing Tide and their raids. We cannot afford to dilute their ranks any further.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: No, we must look to another party for assistance, I'm afraid. Any other ideas?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: The Company of Heroes? Now that's a name I've not heard in some time.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: 'Tis true that they answered the call many a time. Indeed, other than you and yours, there are arguably none better suited to the task of primal slaying.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: But they disbanded over five years ago...and neither hide nor hair has been seen of their commander since.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Aye, absent their leader, I suspect they will be reluctant to join our cause...

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: ...And yet, I can think of no better option. I'll contact Wheiskaet─their erstwhile commander's right-hand man─and see if he will not hear us out.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I will ask him to meet us at the Drowning Wench. Let us hope he is receptive to our offer.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Noll. Might I trust you and your brothers to continue the search for the blasphemy in the meantime?

dialogue.name: NOLL
dialogue.text: Pshhh... But of course, Admiral. Should we dissscover anything, you will be the first to know.

dialogue.name: NOLL
dialogue.text: Pshhh... It is good to see you sssafe, friend.

dialogue.name: LIMSASECRETARY
dialogue.text: Admiral Bloefhiswyn awaits you at South Tidegate. Pray join her as soon as you are able.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: My apologies for the delay.

dialogue.name: Q7
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A7
dialogue.text: You are alone?

dialogue.name: A7
dialogue.text: So your plea fell on deaf ears...

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: (-???-)...And here I swore five years ago that I was done playing hero.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Could someone explain what this is all about? Believe it or not, I am a respectable man with respectable obligations these days.

dialogue.name: UODHNUNH
dialogue.text: Take that polearrrm out of your arrrse, old friend. And stop pretending you're not still a murderous bastard at heart.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Watch that wicked tongue of yours, U'odh, lest I skewer it and prove you right!

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: Ahhh... Nothing like a reunion with dear companions over a bottle of the Wench's finest vintage! That is why we're here, right?

dialogue.name: BRAYFLOX
dialogue.text: Pshhh...! Shkohhh...! Long time no eyecatch, uplanders! Brayflox is tummy-tickled to see gobbiefriends again!

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Thank you for assembling on such short notice.

dialogue.name: UODHNUNH
dialogue.text: Sparrre us the pleasantries, Admiral. Why are we here?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I make a simple request: reform the Company of Heroes, and lend Limsa Lominsa your strength.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Hmm. You've a reason, I'm sure. I would hear it.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: ...So there you have it. A terrible fiend known as a blasphemy prowls our seas, transforming the Sahagin into ravening beasts.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: At the same time, the Sahagin themselves─specifically, a hostile faction calling themselves the Crushing Tide─had declared their intention to summon Leviathan anew. Should they succeed, we would be hard-pressed to deal with the primal while still dealing with the other threats.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: A right pickle, indeed...

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: ...But the answer is no. The commander disbanded the Company, and as his first mate, it's not my place to gainsay his final order.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Sod that, I say. Have you forgotten our company's creed!? “The duty of the strong is to protect the weak!”

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Are the people now in danger not the same men and women we fought to defend years ago? The commander would not have turned his back on them, and neither should we!

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Bold words, Landenel. But do you truly believe that we can honor them as we are?

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Old mercenaries past their prime, lacking the commander whose wisdom and prowess saw them to glory once upon a time...

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Ah, yes. Your commander...

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: What if Forename here were to lead you in his stead? Surely you would not question herhis abilities.

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: ...An intriguing proposition. I, for one, would not be averse to serving under such a decorated hero.

dialogue.name: BRAYFLOX
dialogue.text: Pshhh...! Shkohhh...! Gobbiefriend has goodly head for fighty-think and goodly arms for thinky-fight!

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: As ringing an endorsement as any. But I would hear it from the woman herselfman himself. Do you believe you are capable of leading the Company of Heroes into battle?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: If you've the stones to follow me.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Better battle than a banquet.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Now that's the confidence I'd expect from my commander. Very well, then─consider us yours to lead.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Still nursing that grudge, are we? Aye, I suppose we still owe you a dozen favors. If you're willing to lead, we'll follow.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: <sigh> Five years to the day. Truth be told, I was enjoying the more leisurely life. But when duty calls...

dialogue.name: UODHNUNH
dialogue.text: Wait. Before we proceed, I must ask. Have we no way of reaching out to the commander?

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Forgotten how he took his leave, have we? Up and vanishing so we could each find our own way, apart from him and the Company. I doubt we'll see him again─much as I wish we could.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: To the matter at hand─the missions you will undertake.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: First, you are to aid us tracking down the blasphemy that roams the sea. Second, you must prevent the Crushing Tide from summoning Leviathan at all costs.

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: Oh, is that all? And there I thought we might get our feet wet with a real challenge, heh. But in all seriousness, we should take care to decide who attends to what.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Sounds like a job for our acting commander. I'm sure shehe'll give it all due consideration.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I will reach out to Wheiskaet, the former first mate of the Company, and see if he is willing to meet us at the Drowning Wench.

dialogue.name: NOLL
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Worry not... My ssspawnbrothers and I will keep our eyes on the Crushing Tide in the meantime.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: So if I understand this correctly, we're to bring down this so-called blasphemy. Of course, to do that, we'll need to find the damn thing first.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: We've also got to prevent the Crushing Tide from summoning their god, Leviathan. A tall order in and of itself.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: As acting commander, it's your job to decide who'll be doing what, based on the skills we each have to offer.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: I'd recommend that you start by having a chat with each of us, that you might develop a sense of the strengths and weaknesses─mostly strengths, of course─of the storied veterans under your command.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: My specialty, you ask? Why, impaling fiends with this lance of mine, of course! The stronger the foe, the better─none are a match for me!

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: It would be folly to waste my talents on dealing with those slippery fishmen. Set me against that so-called blasphemy and I'll have the thing on a skewer before you can say “Merlwyb Bloefhiswyn”!

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: Which task will you entrust to Landenel?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Pursuing and slaying the blasphemy.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Preventing the primal summoning.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: A wise choice. Send Landenel after the Sahagin, and he's like to help them summon Leviathan to sate his bloodlust.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Have you lost your wits!? Send Landenel after the Sahagin, and he's like to help them summon Leviathan to sate his bloodlust. Oh, gods help us all...

dialogue.name: UODHNUNH
dialogue.text: I will speak plain: I am not some battle-crazed barrrbarian like Landenel. As nunh of the U, a tribe of peerless hunters, I conduct my affairs with discipline and prrrudence.

dialogue.name: UODHNUNH
dialogue.text: As such, I know better than any that to rrrush headlong into battle is rarely the best course of action. Far wiser it is to observe from afar and proceed with caution.

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: Which task will you entrust to U'odh Nunh?

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: Pursuing and slaying the blasphemy.

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: Preventing the primal summoning.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: It's true that the nunh can hold his own in a fight, but I cannot help but wonder if that's the best use of his─ Ah, but it is your choice to make.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Very astute, if I do say so myself. There are few better suited to the task of averting needless bloodshed than the famously circumspect U'odh Nunh.

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: As you well know, my vision is somewhat lacking these days. I can still defend myself when necessary, but I'd rather it not come to that.

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: My condition also leaves me rather unsuited to scouting and searching. It wasn't always the case, but such is life. On the other hand, I'd like to think I've gotten quite good at sounding out the intentions of others during negotiations and the like...

dialogue.name: Q5
dialogue.text: What task will you entrust to Shamani Lohmani?

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: Pursuing and slaying the blasphemy.

dialogue.name: A5
dialogue.text: Preventing the primal summoning.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: That is an...interesting choice, Commander. Shamani will dutifully perform any task, to be sure, but I can't help but wonder if that's a suitable venue for his particular talents...

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: You've a keen sense for these things, I see. More so than reconnaissance or battle, Shamani has a knack for working behind the scenes to see the Company's goals achieved.

dialogue.name: BRAYFLOX
dialogue.text: Pshhh...! Shkohhh...! Brayflox master remaker of Illuminati treasures! Offers much hand-lending with ingenuity!

dialogue.name: BRAYFLOX
dialogue.text: Farseeing spyglass sees far into oceandeep! Crackfires go boom and blast beasts into bittypieces!

dialogue.name: Q6
dialogue.text: What task will you entrust to Brayflox?

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: Pursuing and slaying the blasphemy.

dialogue.name: A6
dialogue.text: Preventing the primal summoning.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: A logical choice, if I do say so myself. Brayflox's mastery of tools and armaments are sure to avail you in tracking and felling that beast.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: The choice is yours to make, of course. But I cannot help but wonder if Brayflox's talents might be better applied to a less...delicate task.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: It would seem everyone has their assignments.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: And I daresay the choices you've made are nigh impeccable. If I didn't know better, I'd think you'd been leading us for years.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: I can't say I agree with all of your choices, but given that you've only just assumed command, I reckon you've done well enough.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: That said...I must confess that your choices do not exactly inspire me with confidence. I hope that you can improve your grasp of the strengths and weaknesses of those under your command, lest these missions end in disaster.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: And with that, it is time we got to work. I have procured linkpearls for one and all, that we can keep each other apprised of our progress. You may pick them up from Maelstrom Command.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: We'd best be off, then. Should we have need to regroup or reconsider our strategy, call for us.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I will return to Command, and share these developments here with the secretariat and our Sahagin friends. Do join me if you can...Commander Forename.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Wheiskaet may be skeptical, but I for one have little doubt you will prove a worthy commander for the Company of Heroes.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Have we finished with all the logistical nonsense? I'm eager for a taste of the old violence. You know the flavor.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Just point me in the right direction, and my lance will do the rest!

dialogue.name: UODHNUNH
dialogue.text: Please think twice before assigning me to the same grrroup as Landenel. I don't know what's worse─his tendency to wave his lance in people's faces, or all the shouting and blusterrring he engages in while doing so.

dialogue.name: UODHNUNH
dialogue.text: The Company of Heroes may have forrrmed anew, but that does not absolve me of my duties as nunh.

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: The others may gripe and groan, but not me. I'll be the first to admit that I missed the action!

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: The Company may have reformed, but I can't very well let my precious vintage sour.

dialogue.name: BRAYFLOX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Brayflox happily gives hand-lending to uplander!

dialogue.name: BRAYFLOX
dialogue.text: Pshhh... Shkohhh... Uplander can count on Brayflox. Expect much bangyboom and firedoom!

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Oh, it's you. I'd have thought your duties as acting commander would leave you little time for leisure.

dialogue.name: LIMSASECRETARY
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. The Admiral has apprised me of the situation in full.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Furnish Forename with a linkpearl, yes?

dialogue.name: LIMSASECRETARY
dialogue.text: Of course, Admiral.

dialogue.name: LIMSASIGNALLER
dialogue.text: It would seem the Company is trying to reach us.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: (-Landenel-)Ho there, Commander! Just give the word, and I'll come running!

dialogue.name: UODHNUNH
dialogue.text: (-U'odh Nunh-)Lowerrr your godsdamned voice, will you?

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: (-Landenel-)Watch your tongue, or I'll track you down and rip yours out!

dialogue.name: LIMSASECRETARY
dialogue.text: They sound more like mortal enemies than old companions...

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: That's where Forename comes in. I'm trusting you to whip them back into shape. Make them a force to be reckoned with.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I will have the secretariat contact you if there are any developments. I would convey them to the entire Company by linkpearl, but we cannot afford anyone taking reckless action...

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: In the meantime, I will reach out to Noll and see what he has gleaned about the Crushing Tide and their hideout.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Let us hope for good tidings, Commander.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I have just finished briefing the secretariat. She has something you should find useful.

dialogue.name: LIMSASIGNALLER
dialogue.text: Admiral Bloefhiswyn has tasked me with overseeing communications between you and the Company of Heroes. First, you'll be needing a linkpearl. Pray speak with the secretariat.
